intro: Cracca caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina false nettle, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy underside and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has a square stem and is often found in moist, wooded areas. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Its botanical characteristics make it identifiable in its native habitat.
